EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO Partners (1332971295.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Partners (1332971295.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Paul, Glad to hear we are all on the same page. There are a lot of moving parts especially if they get confused with traditional W-2 so I am glad you received clear information. I would like to review our program in greater detail and make a finincal illustration that we can review together. You may easily book a time that is convenient for you on my online schedule by go here. You can also watch a short video about who we are on You Tube. I look forward to speaking with you and sharing more information about MBO Partners! Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: <https://my.timedriver.com/8SLYS> leblancc4i@att.net [mailto:leblancc4i@att.net] Sent: Wednesday, March 28, 2012 1:11 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Partners Sarah thank you and I've talked with an IRS agent that explained things clearly and it matches your info. Hoping to get things moving and you are very busy. Would like to get registered at least in preparation for a deal with Sentek on my pay. S Paul LeBlanc
Sent from my Verizon Wireless 4G LTE DROID
-----Original message-----From: Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>> To: "leblancc4i@att.net" <leblancc4i@att.net <mailto:leblancc4i@att.net>> Sent: Wed, Mar 28, 2012 08:10:41 PDT Subject: MBO PartnersHi Paul, Per our call I wanted to summarize the tax scenarios we spoke about: Traditional W-2 · Typically 6.2% Social Security (4.2% in 2012 due to 2% temporary tax cut)· 1.45 % Medicare· Federal withholding (based on W-4 elections)· Local and state withholding (based on W-4 elections) 1099· Typically 15.3% self-employment tax (12.4% Social Security and 2.9% Medicare double the traditional W-2 responsibility) ** note 13.3% in 2012 due to temporary Social Security 2% tax cut**· Federal withholding (based of AGI)· Local and state withholding (based of AGI) MBO:· Typically 12.4% Social Security (10.4% in 2012 due to temporary 2% Social Security tax cut) · 2.9% Medicare· .8% FUTA (federal unemployment) · SUTA (state unemployment rate depends on sate)· 1% Workmens compensation · Federal withholding (based on W-4 elections)· Local and state withholding (based on elections) Again, MBO is an alternative to running your own business which many consultants have found to be a valuable service. Most of the consul who enjoy using MBO Partners value their time hence enjoy the convenience as an alternative to managing it on their own. For in depth review of our services please visit http://www.mbopartners.com/#whoweare and see how we compare to 1099 by visiting http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Exec_vs_1099_Comparison.pdf We are a 100% optional service. Regards,Sara ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed.
